message: Hi guys. I just posted to HN and would love to listen to your feedback on my site. It is a simple app to manage your business cards better. http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2453747
hi hijimayor, looking forward to seeing what you deliver as i think there is room for improvement in this space.
i like the idea of the progress meter though showign 65%
sorry, that link seems to show up a blank even though it works properly when I'm logged in. Anyway, the site is at www.imeishi.biz
just wanted to say however that your registration form has no lobels - you should put line 1 name line 2 email (lol i just filled out email on both).
@deancollins thanks for the feedback ..may I ask what browser you are using ? on FF, Opera and Safari it shows up as a placeholder

they sure seem to want their mail maintained by third party sites :)
but pretty valid point ..
funny that you mention it because I just studied threads yday and wrote my first threaded downloader :)
@jca yeah I guessed that .. and then confirmed it with a quick google search :(
2ch .. and i could be sure of getting the site taken down if I asked them for advice :)
ah, right, I can see that
nice intro site
@undefined thank you :)
hehe cool
I dont know how it is in the states, but in Japan where I live paper cards are going to stay for a long long time
we are a bunch of students and creating a full blown site really isnt on our agenda
one place to contact me whatever social network im on
i wrote my bot cause i wanted to learn all kinds of programming topics .. threads mysql python etc ;]
I think your page was auto-killed on HN cuz new users aren't allowed to promote their startups.  You have to participate in the community a while first.
yeah its true maybe you can make business cards that point to linkedin facebook twitter etc
wrt your site, I'm not exactly a networking kind of guy, but I don't think I've ever in my life exchanged business cards with anybody...
I'm wondering if people still really use them...  I'm thinking everything's probably done through social networking sites like Facebook and LinkedIn these days...
ok, cool.  Hmm...  maybe you should seek feedback from a Japanese forum?
really tough to come across
japan really isnt a hotspot for entrepreneurs though there are quite a few
hmm yeah... what's that really big japanese board that 4chan is based off of?
maybe you could post there, hehe
wonder though if ppl want to have their cards maintained by a third party site
its kind of personal to have your complete business network on a site maybe ?
dunno
ah students thats perfect .. willing to learn is the key of all things ;]
i started coding my bot 10 years ago or something ;]
threads are cool though except if you want to run them on something like Googles App Engine
